title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Malcolm Fleming ofCumbernauld, a faithful adherent of their house,shared the same fate.

title: Rambles in Europe ... With historical facts relating to Scotch-American families, gathered in Scotland and the North of Ireland ... Illustrated
author: Morrison, Leonard Allison.
snippet: Stark or Starke is a Scottish surname, meaning strong, and was first borne by a person byname of Muirhead, for his having rescued KingJames IV from a bull in the forest of Cumbernauld.

title: The Black Douglas ... Second impression.
author: Crockett, Samuel Rutherford.
snippet: Two of them,the Earl William and his cousin Hugh, were no morethan boys in years, though already old in military exercises; the third, Alan Fleming of Cumbernauld, was astrong horseman and excellent with his lance, though alsoslender of body and more distinguished for dexteritythan for power of arm.
